/*

   Author:

   Pranay Ranjan

   "keep the vigour alive"

*/

#include<stdio.h>

#include<math.h>

prime(unsigned long long n)
{

   unsigned long long root,i,flag=0;

   root=sqrt(n);

   for(i=2;i<=root;i++)
   {

     if(n%i==0)
     {

       flag=1;

       break;

     }

   }

   return flag;

}

int main()
{

   unsigned long long fib[51],i,count=0,ans[10],level;

   fib[0]=1;

   fib[1]=1;

   /* this code checks the first 10 fibonacci numbers which are prime.

   */

   for(i=2;i<51;i++)
   {

     fib[i]=fib[i-1]+fib[i-2];

     if(prime(fib[i]) == 0 && count<10)

     ans[count++]=fib[i];

     else if(count == 10)

          break;

   }

   scanf("%llu",&level);

   printf("%llu\n",ans[level-1]);

   return 0;

}
